title: Thunderbird Freezes whenever I click a Github.com link
content:
I have Thunderbird 128.6.0esr (64-bit) installed as a Flatpack package on Fedora, running on Gnome / Wayland.

Whenever I click a link in from an email from Github, that normally opens the browser, Thunderbird immediately freezes, and Gnome asks me if I want to kill Thunderbird. Waiting never works, and the link never opens. This is somewhat recent behavior.

Links to other websites *do* open. I know how strange this sounds. How can I debug this?
creator: evrt

title: Thunderbird with Exchange - synchronization
content:
Just setup a second Thunderbird profile for Exchange. Using Owl for Exchange plugin.

I right click onto a subfolder, and pick Properties, then go into Synchronization. I click onto a checkbox for "Select this folder for offline use" and I hit OK to close the window. Nothing happens. I go back, and the checkbox is not checked. I tried hitting the Download Now buttons, nothing happened.

Any clue why my check box selection is not accepted?

When I used Outlook, I set it up to use OST, so I have a copy of my email that is on the remote Exchange server. Now I am trying to do the same with Thunderbird.

Thank you
creator: mzl999

title: Thunderbirds 128.6.0esr (64-bit) on Linux Fedora 41 (and older versions) crashes all the time.
content:
Hi Community,

I having the issue, more or less permanently, that Thunderbirds crashes all the time during my normal working hours. Never mind if running in troubleshoot mode or default. I already created:

a) Created the IMAP Files new b) Cache relocation to RAM c) Profile is running on an NVME d) deactivated add-on e) many other things I tried.....

It happens out of a sudden, it just crashes - for 10 - 30 seconds and continues to work. Sometimes 4-5x per hour and then only once on one day. I have no idea anymore. Can I not create a crash report and share it here somehow?

On weird thing. I copied the profile to my second Personalcomputer, a windows 11 machine and with the same profile and settings - Thunderbird does not crash, it was running for days with my Thunderbird Linux profile. Working with Windows is no solution - it was just for the purpose of testing.

Thanks! Wolfgang
creator: wolli.marx

creator: johncage12

title: Syncing accounts and settings between Thunderbird desktop and Thunderbird mobile
content:
I were not sure, where this could belong, therefore I chose "Settings".

I recently switched from K9 Mail to Thunderbird Mobile and were very happy to see, that there has been a migration option to transfer all the account settings from desktop to mobile version.

Well, not all accounts and not all settings were transferred and only the first QR code has been recognized whereas the other three were unrecognizable - but still a good move!

That brought me to the idea: Wouldn't it be nice, if there were some Thunderbird Sync, where all accounts, the server settings, the identities (!!), the signatures (!) and other settings (fonts, quoting etc) would be the same on all devices?

And where would be the place to promote such an idea?
creator: Vince42

title: Folder counts are correct, but when opened mails missing
content:
Hello

Overnight Thunderbird has developed a major problem. The count for the number of mails in a folder is correct, as best I can tell, but when I open the folder it is either empty or has fewer mails than the count. Based on several tests, repairing sometimes adds more mails, sometimes not, but never the entire folder.

I repaired the inbox and it is now showing several mails that I deleted in the last few days (by emptying the delete folder having previously deleted them). Curiously, they’re all the same type, routine mailings about road works.

I may have backup in that I copy the entire Thunderbird folder to an external drive every morning, including today, and to Google Drive every Wednesday.

Please can you help.

Thank you
creator: MrsF
